steps: Soak reeds in water for flexibility.
Start weaving a spiral base using alternating over-and-under patterns.
Gradually curve the weave upwards to form the basket walls.
Secure the rim with a tight binding loop.
Harvest fresh kelp and split into strips.
Twine the kelp strips around a bamboo frame.
Interlock the strips at key points to add structural integrity.
Seal with natural resin if available.
Form a tight coil using willow branches.
Wrap water hyacinth fibers around the coil as you progress.
Ensure consistent tension for an even basket shape.
Finish by tying off the end securely.
Braid the sea vines into three long cords.
Weave the cords into a basket pattern, starting from the base.
Reinforce the sides by adding layers of braided vine.
Use coconut fibers to create a sturdy handle.
Tie an initial knot to secure the frame.
Interweave algae fibers with nylon rope to form the basket body.
Use specialized underwater knot techniques to secure the weave.
Finish by tightening all knots and trimming excess material.
Collect coral branches and arrange them into a frame.
Weave seaweed strips through the coral to form a sturdy basket.
Reinforce weak areas with additional seaweed layers.
Ensure no gaps remain for a watertight finish.
Collect small driftwood pieces and smooth out rough edges.
Create a base by binding pieces together with seagrass ropes.
Weave additional seagrass ropes through the driftwood to form walls.
Secure the top with a final rope loop.
